messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:30): http://www.w3.org/2010/05/video/mediaevents.html is handy
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:33): btw, I was talking with a researcher at work who's interested in using the media API to do some things some things with video
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:33): his question was whether the API provides a way to extract individual frames
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:34): drawImage
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:35): goes to look at drawImage spec
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:36): it just takes whatever the video displays currently and puts it on <canvas>
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:37): void drawImage(in HTMLVideoElement image, in float dx, in float dy, optional in float dw, in float dh);
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:38): what are dx and dy ?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:38): position
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:38): on the canvas grid
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:38): ah, yeah, OK
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:39): so you could call this each time there's a frame change?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, seems that once a <track> is loading putting it on disabled should not cause it to stop loading
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, should prolly work similarly to how <link rel=stylesheet> works; that has pretty much the same issues as far as I can tell
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:39): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: or what event could I use to call it?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:40): is it important that the video plays back smoothly?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:40): he just wants to be able to grab each frame
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:41): otherwise it's prolly better to figure out the framerate and then use seeking and seeking events
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:41): yeah, that's what I had said I thought would work
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:41): to him
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:41): ought to work :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:42): I reckon this is the kind of thing that JS libraries can eventually provide some convenience methods for
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:44): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: does changing .href on <link> cause a stylesheet load to abort?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:45): pretty sure it does
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:45): no reason for it to continue

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (10:53): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: "[video.startTime] It might not be zero if the clip's timeline is not zero-based" - http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete/video.html#video
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (10:53): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: re http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20100518#l-283
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:53): https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=39259 -- cool (via Peter`)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (10:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: although i would be fine with changing the spec so that startTime is 0 even for non-zero-based videos
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:55): wonders why they keep the version in the file names
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:55): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: huh, what do you know
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (10:56): tends to think 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 knows quite a lot
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:58): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, what's the point of startTime then?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:01): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: it updates for streaming video when video data is discarded
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:01): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: although buffered.start(0) also does that
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:01): maybe we should remove startTime and just have buffered.start(0)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:03): wonders what application/srgs+xml is
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): startTime != buffered.start(0)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): the data at startTime might not be buffered
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): startTime is just the earliest point that's ever accessible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): startTime might be equivalent to seekable.start(0)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): i'd have to think about that to be sure
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:06): oh, right, seekable.start(0)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:06): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: have you or others from Apple chimed on in the Typed Arrays draft spec yet?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:07): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I know olliej is interested
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:07): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I plan to read over it very soon
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:07): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I would like to propose changes to make it serve the use cases I envisioned for BinaryData
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:07): so there can be one true way to represent synchronously accessible in-memory binary data
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:08): use cases.. would be good to have somebody collect those
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:08): Typed Arrays are an agenda item for the upcoming TC-39 meeting
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:08): ah, good
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:08): about time
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:08): when is that meeting?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:09): one try way would be great..
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (11:09): I believe it is the 24th and 25th of this month
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:10): Kanji beats English by almost 2.5 to 1
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:10): but from the little I know about TC-39 I suspect that getting agreement on the one try way for this is not going to be very quick or smooth
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:10): toally unfair on twitter
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:10): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: the character count you mean?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:10): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, yeah, http://twitter.com edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e/status/14214874107
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:11): I figured it took at least twice as much for a normal message in English
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:12): so the lesson here is that everybody should learn Japanese and tweet in Japanese
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:12): for the greatest efficiency
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:12): actually, I guess Chinese might be even more efficient
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:12): but maybe not
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:13): I was thinking that because Chinese doesn't have a separate phonetic alphabet like Japanese does
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:13): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, hmm yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:13): but then I realized, it's the same count anyway, because you're just using the logograms for phonetic purposes
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:14): 8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21: Hey, I saw your email; short answer is no.
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:15): twitter should translate to english before applying the character count
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:15): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: yeah, that would even the playing field
8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21 (11:15): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: thanks.  did you author the existing tests by hand/
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:17): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: watcha up to tonight?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:17): or in other words, check yo email
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:21): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: meetings from 7pm til midnight, unfortunately
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:22): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: but can meet up with you all tomorrow night
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:22): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: ouch. Red Bar at 12:30 then? :D j/k (orishe?)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:23): no Red Bar for me tonight
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:23): not in the mood to deal with Yuji
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:23): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: you'll still be in town tomorrow night?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:25): CSS issue, but no way to calculate device ppi because CSS absolute units use 96dpi-derived (not calculated) cms. big pita given current mobile landscape
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:25): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yeah here til Thurs
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:31): where do wwwstyle ppl hang out on IRC? ‚Ä¶ here? :|
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:31): here mostly I guess
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:31): #CSS on irc.w3.org:80 is somewhat reserved for the CSS WG
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:33): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: is that private?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:34): aah web-based
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:35): not sure what the policy is, it's logged
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:35): and it's not web-based... it's an IRC channel
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:37): 8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21: I authored very few of them, they're just the tests from html5lib

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:38): 8b7a8196348038c107614af0b08f2d21: A load of them were programmatically created by Philip`, hsivonen tends to write the majority of new ones nowadays AFAIK, 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 hand-wrote a whole load for the script parsing
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (11:38): is at his desk again
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:38): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e wrote the initial batch
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): James and I added a couple; the rest is how a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 sketched it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): if this is about html5lib tests
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:42): I add some when we have bugs that get fixed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:43): wonders what the original question was

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (11:44): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks ‚Äî left a question there. what settings are you using for #CSS btw? tried irc.w3.org:80 and :6667 but doesn‚Äôt seem to connect in Colloquy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:44): some opera person should point emoller to the <device> part of the spec

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:45): (if the question was something like "do we have a way of autogenerating interesting cases from the spec" the answert is "no but that is something I would really like")
